intro: Elytranthe farinosa, commonly known as the starchy leaved plant, is a herbaceous perennial native to South America. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. Elytranthe farinosa is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or stream banks. Its unique foliage and delicate flowers make it a notable addition to botanical gardens and wetland habitats.
